result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:28 AM Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gary L Bucholtz in court, in custody. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant does not have an attorney yet.  Defendant needs more time to retain counsel/time for SPD to appoint counsel. Defendant requests a bail reduction.
State objects, believes bond set is appropriate. 
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits.
Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on September 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
from SPD, no attorney appointment as of today. 17 contacts.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Do not drive at all. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.

2:15 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gary L Bucholtz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Natalie Probst appeared by video for Gary L Bucholtz. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
